fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Jira Cloud App gets stuck when scrolling on an issue with a Table added
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a table to the Description field
 # Try to scroll using your mobile device
h3. Expected Results
Scroll all the issue
h3. Actual Results
The app gets stuck and you are not able to scroll
h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Jira Cloud App gets stuck when scrolling on an issue with a Table added

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When seeing the option order of a custom field in the new issue view, it does not reflect the order in the field configuration.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

* Create a custom field with some options;
* Put them in a different order from the one you created;
* Check the field in iOS app

h3. Expected Results

The order will be reflected.


h3. Actual Results

It orders differently.


h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no workaround available for this bug
fields.summary: iOS app does not reflect field options order

fields.description:
h3. Summary
JIRA iOS - Can't change the reporter to portal only user

h3. Environment
Jira iOS app.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a ticket on a Service Desk project;
# Open the ticket on the iOS mobile app;
# Attempt to change the reporter to a portal only user;
# Jira keeps searching but never finds.

h3. Expected Results
JIRA iOS app should find the portal only user.

h3. Actual Results
JIRA iOS app keeps searching but never finds.

h3.Workaround
Use the desktop view on the browser.
fields.summary: JIRA Mobile - Can't change the reporter to portal only user

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When the user accesses an issue with the [Jira Cloud app|https://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/mobile-app] for Android, the comment field will not be displayed if the project role does is not included in the *View Development Tools* permission. Even if the role is added to the *Add comment* permission, the field will not be visible.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have the Jira app installed in Android (which is the OS used for the test)
# Create a project and one or more test issues in this project.
# [Create a role|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/managing-project-roles-776636382.html] to be used for the test.
# Create/edit a permission scheme to include the role in the *Add comment* permission.
# Make sure that the role *is not added* to the *View Development Tools*. Feel free to add a different role for it.
# On the project, tap *Project settings* > *People* to add the user/group to the role (see [adding a user to a project role|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/managing-project-role-membership-776636387.html])
# Have added to this role to open Jira with the mobile app and access one of the created issues

h3. Expected Results
The comment field should be loaded, like in the example below:
 !with_comment.jpg|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
The comment field is not displayed:
 !no_comment.jpg|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Refresh the issue (pushing down) to have it displayed again.
fields.summary: Comment field is not displayed if the role does not have "View Development Tools" permission

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Unable to visualize issues, with the issue has the property jira.permission.create.clone.denied on the status.

h3. Steps to replicate
Create project with the property jira.permission.create.clone.denied
Create issue
Transition issue to the status with the property

h3. Expected Result
Able to visualize the issue

h3. Actual Result
Unable to visualize the issue.

h3. Workaround
Remove the property will make the issue appear. After that, you can add the property back, that the issue will continue to show up.
fields.summary: Android Mobile App users cannot see issues in a state with jira.permission.create.clone.denied

fields.description:
h3. Summary

In Mobile, for a user who has 'Set issue security' permissions.
They are able to create an issue in Mobile app and the issue will be set as the Default issue security level.
That is because the field for Issue security is not shown up in Mobile even though users have 'Set issue security' permission.
This results in :

The user or reporter will not be able to access the issue if they do not have access to the default security level

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Assign yourself set issue security permission
 # Proceed to create two security level and make one as default. (!) Ensure that you do not have access to the default issue security.
 # In mobile, proceed to create an issue in the project. (i) The option to choose issue security is not available

h3. Expected Results

- The field issue security is available
- Should not be able to create the issue without issue security level field set

 

h3. Actual Results

- Field is not available

h3. Notes

h3.Workaround  

Currently no workaround
fields.summary: In Mobile, able to create issue with Default issue security level even with Set issue security permission

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

After creating a User Picker custom field and trying to use on Jira Cloud Mobile app, does not allow to select a user that has a long display name into the custom field.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a User Picker (single user) custom field
 # Create 2 users one as *Test User* and another one as *Testing Company Name Corporation and LTD*
 # On your IOS mobile try to use the Custom Field and search for the *Testing Company Name Corporation and LTD* and it will just show the *Searching...* word and it will not bring any results

h3. Expected Results

- It should bring all the users available

h3. Actual Results

- It only brings some users that do not have a long displayed name

h3. Workaround

Currently, the only workaround is to select the user from Jira on a Desktop and not the Jira Cloud Mobile app.
fields.summary: Custom Field setup as User Picker is incomplete

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Deleting a project in Jira Mobile doesn't send it to the projects trash. It actually deletes it permanently.
Also no documentation states that the feature works differently or it's not supported in the mobile version.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access Jira's app in the mobile
# Delete a project through project details

h3. Expected Results
Project should be sent to projects trash.

h3. Actual Results
Project is deleted permanently straight away.

h3. Workaround
No workarounds were found on top of deleting the project through a the web version of Jira.
fields.summary: Deleting a project in Jira Mobile doesn't send it to the trash, it deletes it permanently

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Creating a subtask which has a required field fails to save.

h3. Environment
* This can be reproduced on both Jira Android and iOS applications

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add a required field to a Sub-task screen
# Try creating Sub-task from the Mobile Application

h3. Expected Results
The subtask gets created.

h3. Actual Results
"Failed to save" error is returned.

 !Screenshot_20181001-144520.jpg|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Jira Mobile-Can't create Subtask if a required field is present

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

On iOS devices for the Jira mobile app, you the option to edit or delete worklogs is unavailable making it impossible to update or delete existing worklogs.

This option is available on Android devices but isn't available on iPhones, iPads or the Mac app.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Log work on a Jira Issue
 # On an iOS device, go to the Issue and expand the *Time tracking* field

h3. Expected Results

Just like in the Android app, there should be 3-dots with *Edit* and *Delete* option.

 !Screenshot_20200218-164604_Jira.jpg|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results

There is no 3-dots nor any options to perform these actions.

h3. Workaround

No workaround from an iOS device. The entry will have to be deleted/edited from an Android device or Desktop version of Jira.
fields.summary: Cannot edit or delete worklogs on iOS

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
"Issues in this epic" is limited to show the first 50 chield issues in Jira Mobile.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an Epic with more than 50 child issues.
 # Open this Epic on Jira Mobile.

h3. Expected Results
You should see all chield issues associated with the Epic.

h3. Actual Results
You are limited to see the first 50 child issues associated with the Epic.

h3. Workaround
Use a web browser.
fields.summary: Jira mobile - "Issues in this epic" is limited to show the first 50 child issues.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

For iOS app or Mac app:

If you use default value for a multiline text field, this value won't appear when creating issue.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open iOS app or Mac app
 # Open filters
 # Tap on create issue button
 # And choose your project which has multiline text field that uses default value

h3. Expected Results

The create issue dialog will show the default value for the multiline text field
h3. Actual Results

The create issue dialog show empty value for the multiline text field
h3. Workaround

Leave the field empty and modify it later after issue created.
fields.summary: Create issue on iOS or Mac app not showing default value for multiline text field

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The *Message Custom Field (for edit)* custom field does not display on Android devices on transition Screen

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Message Custom Field (for edit) custom field and add it to a transition Screen (eg: resolve)
# Transition an Issue using the JIRA mobile app on an Android device.

h3. Expected Results
The message of the field should display on the transition Screen

h3. Actual Results
The field is completely ignored
 !Screenshot_20180726-141348_Jira.jpg|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes
This bug does not apply for IOS devices and displays as expected.

h3.Workaround
No workaround
fields.summary: Message Custom Field (for edit) not displayed on Android devices

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The Issue created (reported) notification does not work on Jira mobile. 

h3. Environment
Jira Mobile

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Update notification scheme of the project (add user or group for issue created event).
# Impersonate a user and create an issue called 'Test Notification' without any assignee. 
# E-mail notification for 'Issue Created' is received by user (me),  Notification from app is not received.

h3. Expected Results
Notification should be received on both email and Jira mobile for issue created

h3. Actual Results
No notification received on Jira mobile

h3. Workaround
Currently, none.
fields.summary: Issue created (reported) notification not working on Jira mobile

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Jira mobile APP crashes with "invalid characters" 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Make sure that *Enable HTML email parsing* is enabled under JSD mail handler set up:
** https://INSTANCE_URL.atlassian.net/secure/admin/SDMailInfo.jspa
* Send an email with the following markup:
{noformat}
************************************************************************************ 
Some content....
************************************************************************************
{noformat}
* Pay attention that on the first line of asterisks it must has a blank space at the end, so Jira is going to parse all those asterisks as bullet points.


h3. Expected Results
* Able to access the ticket via Jira mobile App

h3. Actual Results
The app just crashes while trying to access the ticket.
 
h3. Notes
* Tested on IOS 12.3.2

If you access the ticket via Jira interface you will see something like shown below:
* !bullet.png|thumbnail!


h3. Workaround
* While accessing the ticket via the old issue view(desktop only) we can also edit the description in *text mode* and remove the blank space.
* Disable the HTML parse for such a scenario(first step on how to reproduce).
fields.summary: Jira mobile APP crashes with many bullet points

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Using "Status" to filter issues for multiple projects in Jira mobile app does not list out correct status.

h3. Environment

Jira Cloud - iOS

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Click on Issues tab at the bottom of the screen and click on "Search issues"
 # Select at least 2 projects and click on "Status" drop-down

h3. Expected Results

User should see all the statuses available in all the projects selected.

h3. Actual Results

* If classic projects exist, when there are no project selected or multiple selected, "Status" list all available statuses
* If only next-gen projects exist, when there are no project selected  or multiple selected, "Status" list is empty
* If only one project is selected, "Status" shows the correct list

h3. Workaround

Select only one project in order to filter using "Status".
fields.summary: Filtering by "Status" in mobile app for multiple projects does not list correct status

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In the mobile app, the option to estimate time is  called *Time estimate*. 

The fields requires the *Time tracking* field to be added to the screen.

Currently, when clicking on that field inside a Next-gen project's issue, nothing happens. And since the option to adjust time is not available when logging time in mobile, it is not possible to estimate time at all.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

* When viewing an issue (Next-gen) in the mobile app, try to click on *Time estimate*.

h3. Expected Results

The view to estimate time will be displayed.

h3. Actual Results

In Android, nothing happens when you try to click on that button:
 !Next-gen project time estimate disabled.jpg|thumbnail! 

In iOs, an error message stating that the time tracking field is not on the screen will be displayed:
 !IMG_3355.jpg|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Adjust the remaining time when logging hours in the web version.
fields.summary: It is not possible to estimate time in Next-gen projects' issues in the mobile app

fields.description:
||Update on 2020-12-15||
|Hi :) everyone, we added the feature back with the opt-in configuration in Jira Settings -> System -> Look and feel -> Favicon. The Jira Admin user can enable the feature by clicking the checkbox of the "*Use project avatar/icon as favicon*". 
!Screen Shot 2020-12-15 at 3.49.00 pm.png|width=695,height=288!
This feature with the opt-in configuration has rollout to all users, please feel free to enable it if you want to continue to use project avatar as favicon. 
Thanks again for your interest!|

 
{panel:title=Update on 2020-10-23}
Hi everyone :) Thank you for your interest and feedback with regards to project based browser tab icons (favicon).
 A few weeks ago, we released a feature as an experiment, where 50% of Jira Cloud sites had their tab icon changed to the project avatar, instead of the default Jira logo (or a custom image upload).
 We have decided to stop the experiment for the time being. All users should now see the same favicon as they did before the experiment had started.
 We really appreciate all the feedback that you have provided over this period. They give valuable insights which will help inform our next steps with this feature.
 Please feel free to continue to let us know what you think here. Thanks again for your interest!
{panel}
 

 

The favicon (browser tab icon) of Jira pages have recently been changed to use the project avatar. Previously, the product logo was used.

It could be good to have the ability to decide which gets used as the tab icon.
fields.summary: Optional use of project avatar as browser tab icon (favicon)

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When creating a project type scoped rule to add comments on JSD projects, the "Share with customer" checkbox will not show up on the comment settings.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a global "Add comment" rule.
# On the "Rule details" select "Project type" as *Scope* and "Service Desk" as the *Project type*

h3. Expected Results

You'll be able to set the automation comment to be customer-facing.
 !image-2020-10-08-18-19-40-037.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
The "Share with customer" checkbox will not show up.
 
 !image-2020-10-08-18-20-12-542.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
Create a multi-project rule and add all your SDs projects to the scope.
fields.summary: Share with customer checkbox won't show up for Project Type scoped rules

fields.description:
Jira taking up 98% of my CPU bringing entire site to a gridlock. Efficiency really goes out the window when the entire webpage locks up for 15 seconds while typing a comment.

Happy to confirm this issue does not exist on the native app and is almost non-existent when using the browser version on Chrome... however when switching over to FF there is a large noticeable hiccup in performance.

Firefox is up-to-date and I have had other members of the team mention similar issues when using Jira on Firefox v.s. Chrome.

It's also worth mentioning when I move over to my desktop machine which has 32gb of ram the issue doesn't exist. My laptop has 16gb DDR3.
fields.summary: Improve CPU usage on Firefox
Issue Activity - Show ALL Comments

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When creating custom _Parent link_ type custom fields, restricting the field by applying a field context or hiding it in the field configuration affects the existing fields of this type, notably the original *Parent link* field from Advanced Roadmaps.

This means that any restrictions you've applied to the custom field would also be applied to the original system field as well.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new custom field using the _Parent link_ field type (eg: Parent feature)
 # Apply a field context that restricts this field to only the Story issue type OR change the field behavior to hidden in the field configuration

h3. Expected Results

That specific *Parent feature* custom field should have the applicable field context applied and be restricted to only Story issue types OR be hidden.

h3. Actual Results

The original *Parent link* system field is also affected by this restriction and parent Issue types like *Initiative* do not display any *Child issues*.

 !_FAT-2__FATHER_-_Jira.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

You have to remove any restrictions done on the custom field in order for the *Parent link* field to work as expected and have Issues display the *Child issues*.
fields.summary: Restricting custom Parent link type fields affects existing ones

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The option "*Rank to top*" and "*Rank to bottom*" should be shown inside of an issue type e.g.: *TASK* into the *New Jira issue view*.
h4. A scenario where should appear
{panel}
a) open an issue type e.g.: *TASK* >>  go to a ticket detail page in the old issue view
 b) click on the '...' menu AT THE TOP RIGHT
 c) see the options to Rank to Top and Rank to Bottom.
 d) switch to *new issue view*.
 e) open an issue type e.g.: *TASK* >> go to a ticket detail page in the new issue view.
 f) click on the '...' menu AT THE TOP RIGHT
 g) see that there are NO OPTIONS to Rank to Top and Rank to Bottom.
{panel}
*Important*: This feature request (JRACLOUD-75253) is not a duplicate of JRACLOUD-72983 because this feature request only considers the scope under the EPIC.

h3. Where this should appear
 * Old issue view, where these options appear with success.
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
 * Where this should appear into the new Jira issue view.
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: "Rank to top" and "Rank to bottom" should be shown inside of an issue type e.g.: TASK in the New Jira issue view

fields.description:
What the customer wants

Given
 * I have a project scoped custom field with options

When
 * I modify an option

Then
 * I should be able to modify the option

Current implementation supports global scoped fields only
 * [https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/api-group-issue-custom-field-options/#api-rest-api-3-customfield-fieldid-option-put]
fields.summary: API unable to return field options when context is not global
Components drop-down menu should list only target project related items on Create/Clone Issue action

fields.description:
Hi there!
There isn't custom field type like table, its strange.. 

Do you have possibility to create a new *custom field* type "*table*"?
For example it will be good, if table will be flexible. Until you fill in the first line, you will not be able to fill in the second.  Also make the column names smart, the ability to copy table values.

Thanks!
fields.summary: Create a custom field "table"

fields.description:
1.When I select any project and click "Issues", it always shows Open issue by default, can I change the default setting?
2. JIRA treat the issue in Open or not by Resolution, it is possible to use the status field instead of Resolution? Sometimes Resolution will be modified to rejected or can't reproduce then it may be back to "Unresolved". But JIRA still treats the issue is not in an "open" state due to the Resolution is changed before.

Reporter: Keefe
E-mail: keefe.lin@topviewcorp.com
fields.summary: Default issue search is for Open issue,can we change it?

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If an issue has multiple components and the default assignees of components clash, the assignee is set randomly (not alphabetically).
In [Managing components|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jseng/managing-components-881686586.html], the following is stated
{quote}If an issue has multiple components, and the default assignees of components clash, the assignee will be set to the default assignee of the component that is first alphabetically.
{quote}
However, in practice, the behavior is different from this.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create multiple components with default assignee
 # Create a new ticket with multiple components

h3. Expected Results

The assignee is set to the default assignee of the component that is first alphabetically.
h3. Actual Results

The assignee is set randomly

*TEST*
 I created five users(Aihara, Aoki, aoki, あおき, 青木)
||1. Order by user name alphabetically||2. Order by email alphabetically||3. Order by result sorted by "component"||4. Order by result sorted by "component lead"||
|Aihara​|Aoki​|​あおき|Aoki​|
|​Aoki|あおき​|​Aihara|aoki​|
|​aoki|​Aihara|​aoki_|​青木|
|あおき​|​aoki|​Aoki|​Aihara|
|青木|青木​|​青木|あおき|
 * Aihara vs. Aoki => Aihara was set to assignee, so No.2 and No.4 are not reflected.
 * Aoki vs. aoki => Aoki was set to assignee, so No.3 are not reflected.
 * あおき vs. Aihara => Aihara was set to assignee, so No.2 and No.3 are not reflected.
 * Aihara vs. 青木 => 青木 was set to assignee, so No.1, No.2, No.3 was not reflected.

h3. Workaround

No workarounds.
fields.summary: If an issue has multiple components and the default assignees of components clash, the assignee is set randomly (not alphabetically)

fields.description:
The pie chart gadget only allow user to group the issues count by a dropdown field which recently being limited to 55 options. This is quite restrictive when creating real time dashboard. 

 

I will like to suggest to allow the grouping by short text field so that user will not be limited by the number of options. By doing this, it also allow the end user to key in the data with a project admin to pre create all options.
fields.summary: Allow Group By Short Text Field for Pie Chart Gadget

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

when using backticks to convert text to code format text is decomposed
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an issue and write something on wiki-style description
 # Use backticks to convert to code this text
 # The text will be decomposed with a separation of a single quote.

h3. Expected Results

To show the text in code mode only as it is
h3. Actual Results

!2020-10-03_17-33-58.gif!
h3. Workaround

Start with a backtick and then write the text and end with a backtick, or select the line and type control + shift + m
fields.summary: when using backticks to convert text to code format text is decomposed

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Adding user’s from Group shows as 200 Status when doing in bulk, however the user is not removed or Added

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Use the REST api with a python to bulk add groups.
 # It shows status 200, but the user isn't really added.

h3. Expected Results
Using endpoint /rest/api/3/group/user to add / remove users in bulk when having apostrophe in the group name should result in 404

{code}
https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/api-group-groups/#api-rest-api-3-group-user-post{code}

Extra Note:
eg of language use is Python, when using a for loop and reading the data from a csv file to add / remove users in bulk such behaviour is noticeable


h3. Actual Results
using /rest/api/3/group/user to add / remove users in bulk shows as 200 status code for Adding / removing users which is wrong.
e.g. groupname = Felix's

h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Removing / Adding user’s from Group shows as 200 Status when doing in bulk, however the user is not removed or Added.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
After creating an issue inside of a "*parent*" issue we'll miss the option "*Link Confluence page*" into the child issue.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an issue to be the "*parent*";
 # Create another issue to be the child issue;
 # I would like to emphasize that we need to create inside of the "*parent issue*";
 !image-2020-10-06-17-29-54-468.png|width=445,height=260!
 # Then, access the child issue.
 !image-2020-10-06-17-30-22-691.png|width=401,height=181!

 * I've recorded this [video|https://share.getcloudapp.com/jkuDn0JA] with the steps.

h3. Expected Results
 * This option "*Link Confluence page*" should appear.

h3. Actual Results
 * The option "*Link Confluence page*" did not appear.

h3. Workaround
We need to refresh the page to load the option "*Link Confluence page*".
fields.summary: The option "Link Confluence page" is not loading into the child issue after creating

fields.description:
For now, there is no way for the customer to know who/when/what changed/deleted the Priority field or default fields.

It would be great if this information is added to the audit logs.
fields.summary: Audit logs don't show when Priority field is edited.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When editing the access to a filter, the drop-down menu showing groups or projects doesn't show the full name of the project or group. If you have projects or groups with long similar names it can be difficult to find the right one from the drop-down menu.

 !filter_groups.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution
Increase the size of the drop-down menu showing the project/group name, or show the full project or group name when hovering the mouse over the name in the list.

h3. Workaround
Manually enter the correct project/group name in the field to limit the results displayed in the drop-down menu.
fields.summary: Unable to see complete project or group name in filter access drop-down

fields.description: The customer is looking for a feature to have an option to add a custom date picker field along with start and end sprint date.
fields.summary: Custom field(data&time picker) similar to start and end sprint date

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Users would like to retrieve the description of group(s) via API.
 Currently this is not possible using any of the group picker API endpoints.

!Screenshot 2020-10-06 at 12.48.17 PM.png|width=343,height=125!
fields.summary: Ability to retrieve the description of a group(s) via API

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At the moment, when Automation for JIRA received at the client end, in their email header update with *(Client did not present a certificate)*. This is due it is using Postfix to verify their incoming email. As the notification is sent by Sparkpost and it is processed by AmazonSES, it not supported to provide their certificate.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow Postfix to get the AmazonSES certificate

h3. Why this is important
This is to assure the user received email from a certified mail server.
fields.summary: bounce.automationforjira.com mail server able to provide certificate information for client Postfix checked

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In the old issue view, editing custom multi-line text fields are sometimes not saved
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a custom multi-line text field to an issue
 # Add values to the field, save and edit again.

h3. Expected Results
The edited value would be saved.
h3. Actual Results
The edited value are not saved and requires a second edit

h3. Workaround

# Use the new issue view.
# If old issue view is still required, edit the field a second time before saving again.
fields.summary: Editing custom multi-line text field in the old issue view has inconsistent behavior

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Even though the documentation [Configuring time tracking|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/configuring-time-tracking-818578858.html] mentions that decimal values are accepted in the number of hours in your working day, this doesn't seem to work.

||Field||	Description||
|Working hours per day|	The number of hours in your working day (decimal values are accepted).|

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to you *Time tracking* page: [https://YOUR_INSTANCE.atlassian.net/secure/admin/TimeTrackingAdmin.jspa]
# Click on the *Edit global settings* button
# Set a decimal value for the *Working hours per day*
# Refresh the page

h3. Expected Results
The decimal value is accepted as +Working hours per day+.

h3. Actual Results
Despite none error being shown, the decimal value isn't accepted. [Click here|https://share.getcloudapp.com/llu2wO48] to check a video of this behavior.


h3. Workaround

 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Decimal values aren't accepted by Time tracking

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Text fields (Multiple lines) are not properly updating in the old issue view of Jira when using the inline editing.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a text custom field (E.g: Acceptance Criteria) and add it to your project screens
 # Create a new issue and add any value to the text field created (e.g: test 1)
 # In the old issue view, navigate to the issue created and try to inline edit the field

h3. Expected Results

The field is properly updated with a value 
h3. Actual Results

The field is not updated, however, sometimes it gets updated after refreshing the page or adding a new value to the field. It seems to be only a displaying issue. 

[Vídeo with the detailed steps|https://www.loom.com/share/fbe80c3123ff4af89d137d7277e86a37]
h3. Workaround
 # Use the Edit button to properly edit your field:
!Screen Shot 2020-10-05 at 13.14.54.png|width=272,height=148!
 # Use the detail view of your board (Kanban or Scrum):
!Screen Shot 2020-10-05 at 13.25.27.png|width=324,height=102!
fields.summary: Custom Text fields not getting updating with the inline edit in the old issue view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Some add-ons send empty "PUT" requests towards an issue's URL. That PUT request changes the issue's "Updated" field to the timestamp of the request, even if nothing has actually been changed in the issue. This breaks the "order by Updated DESC" sorting in JQL

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have a premium subscription with Automation 4 Jira
 # Use Jira normally
 # Perform a JQL with "order by updated DESC"

h3. Expected Results
The first issues are the ones that have been edited / changed most recent

h3. Actual Results
Sometimes, it is possible to have issues with the "updated" timestamp very recent, even if they weren't updated for a very long time. 

The screenshot below is taken in October 2020 and the issue is seen as updated 5 hours ago. Investigation shows that Automation for Jira sent an empty PUT request
 !image__14_.png|thumbnail! 



h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Add-ons can change an issue's "updated" timestamp even if they don't actually update anything in the issue

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When commenting on the issue key in the Old Issue View, the issue key is converted to a link. However, when seeing this link in the New Issue View we can see that an unwanted *#icft=<issue_key>* URL parameter was added to the issue.

This parameter causes e-mail and Slack notification to break as the example below:
{code:java}
Last comment with .text:
Atlassian Test
   
               
           
           MBI-1032
       
                                                   Start{code}
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Comment in an issue in the Old Issue View either using bracket notation [ISSUEKEY-123] or simply typing ISSUEKEY-123. This can also be done using Automation by adding a comment with the Smart Value \{triggerIssue};
 # Access the New Issue View and mouse over the issue URL.
 # It is possible to see the *#icft=<issue_key>* breadcrumb added to the issue URL.

h3. Expected Results

The issue URL won't contain the *#icft=<issue_key>* breadcrumb.
h3. Actual Results

The issue URL looks as below:
!Image 2020-10-05 at 10.09.48 AM.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround

Use the new issue view as the conversion won't happen.
fields.summary: Issue keys on comments made in the old issue view are rendered with a "#icft=KEY" breadcrumb breaking the link for customers

fields.description:
Currently, the Epic shows the progress for all Stories (or other issue types) below it.

As a user that runs reports using Jira (JQL) it would be really important to get the progress of Epics based on the subtasks below those Stories also.

 !image-2020-10-05-10-07-17-357.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Subtask progress on the Epic level

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Transitioning an issue with Automation for Jira doesn't re-index the transitions for new status in the new view.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new rule in *Project Automation* that makes a transition when the issue is assigned
 # Assign the issue using the new view

h3. Expected Results

Both the status and transitions will update without refreshing the page.
h3. Actual Results

The status is updated, but the transitions that appear are from the previous status.
h3. Workaround

Refreshing the page will update the transitions.
h4. Demonstration
 !bug.gif!
fields.summary: Transitioning a issue with Automation for Jira doesn't re-index the transitions for new status in the new view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Changing the status of a subtask issue is not updated in the parent issue view until the parent issue is re-opened
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Under a Jira project, create an issue of standard issue type (Story, bug, etc)
 * In the newly created issue view, create a subtask issue and open it.
 * In the subtask issue view, change the status of the issue (Example: To Do -> In Progress)
 * Now click on the parent issue seen on the subtask view to navigate back to the parent issue view.

Here is a screen recording of the issue: [^Screen Recording 2020-10-05 at 3.56.03 PM.mov]
h3. Expected Results

The subtask status should be updated in "In Progress"
h3. Actual Results

The subtask status is not updated and shows the previous status.
h3. Workaround

Re-open the parent issue to see the updated subtask status.
fields.summary: Changing the status of a subtask issue is not updated in the parent issue view until the parent issue is re-opened/refreshed

fields.description: Provide support for Advanced Roadmaps fields (for example, Team field in A4J rules) in Automation rules.
fields.summary: Support for Advanced Roadmap fields in Automation for Jira

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Automation for Jira is unable to pick the {{{{webhookData}}}} smart value for the incoming webhook
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an A4J rule, *trigger with Incoming Webhook*
 # *Action: Edit Issue Fields* - {{{{webhookData}}}} is not updating the Jira fields.

h3. Expected Results

{{webhookData}} smart value should work to update the Jira fields.
h3. Actual Results

{{webhookData}} smart value is not picking the Jira fields.

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Automation for Jira is unable to pick the {{webhookData}} smart value for the incoming webhook

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
It is no longer possible to use the arrow keys to select among existing EpicLinks using the up/down arrow key

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new issue
 # select the epic link using the up/down arrow key from the dropdown.

h3. Expected Results
Possibility to use arrow keys (or other keyboard shortcuts) to select an existing epic link from a dropdown list.

h3. Actual Results
Not possible to use arrow keys or any other keyboard shortcut to select an existing epic link from a dropdown list

h3. Workaround
a) Once you find the correct option you would like to use on that field, go down with the arrow and hit TAB from your keyboard
b) Use the mouse
fields.summary: No longer possible to use the arrow keys to select among existing EpicLinks using up/down arrowkey

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
By accessing a Jira filter, if you click on an issue and open it on the same page, the scroll bar will no longer work if you're using the Old Issue View. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
(!) To reproduce it, you have to have Jira Labs disables on your Personal Settings.

# Access a Jira filter (the URL will be like: *instance_name.atlassian.net/issues/?filter=<filter_id>*
# Click to open an issue at the same page (do not open it on a different page)
# The URL for this ticket will be like this: *instance_name.atlassian.net/browse/<ISSUE_KEY>?filter=<filter_id>*

h3. Expected Results
The scroll bar should work as expected

h3. Actual Results
The issue gets stuck and doesn't scroll up or down

h3. Workaround
* Use the New Issue View
* Or open the ticket on a new tab
fields.summary: Accessing an issue from a filter makes scroll bar not working on the Old Issue View

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
the componentsLeadByUser function in JQL still uses user_name as argument. 
This is fine for most cases, but will fail if the display_name is different than the user_name

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have a user whose "user_name" is different than the "display_name". This can usually happen after an import from Server where the email address matches an existing AA ID
 # Add that user as a component lead
 # Perform a JQL:
{code}
component in componentsleadbyuser(that_user)
{code}

h3. Expected Results
The issues with that component will show as results
h3. Actual Results
The JQL will throw an error:
"Function 'componentsleadbyuser' can not generate a list of components for user 'display_name'; the user does not exist.

h3. Workaround
Provide the AAID (Atlassian Account User Id) as an argument to {{componentsLeadByUser()}} function instead of a user name.  In order to learn what the AAID of particular user is, one may try building a JQL query in Advanced Mode for an {{assignee}} field, i.e. {{assignee = _start_typing_user_name_}}.  User picker would pop up and the query would be completed with the selected user AAID, e.g. {{asignee = abcde-12345}}.  Copy that AAID into the original {{component in componentsLeadByUser(abcde-12345)}} query.
fields.summary: the componentsLeadByUser function in JQL still uses user_name as argument

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
"ORDER BY" created date and duedate not working from quick filters
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a quick filter using the *ORDER BY* created or duedate ASC or DESC
h3. Expected Results
Show the issues based on the filter
h3. Actual Results
It will not respect the rule from the filter, and they will still show the issues like you did not select any quick filter

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be to use the JQL query in the Advanced Search screen
fields.summary: "ORDER BY" created date and duedate not working from quick filters

fields.description:
The API endpoint {{/rest/api/3/workflow}} includes in its response the date and time when the last update was made in a given workflow, as described [here|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/api-group-workflows/#api-rest-api-3-workflow-get].

The same documentation [here|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/api-group-workflows/#api-rest-api-3-workflow-get] says that this endpoint was deprecated and the replacement for this would be the endpoint {{/rest/api/3/workflow/search}}, but this endpoint doesn't include the date and time when the last update was made in a given workflow.

As a Jira user, I want the endpoint {{/rest/api/3/workflow/search}} to include the date and time when the last update was made in a given workflow.
fields.summary: As a Jira user, I want to be able to see the last modified date of a workflow via API

fields.description:
Requirement -

To generate a report showing the active/suspended/delete users and have it sent to admin's mailbox on a monthly basis might help organisation with auditing purpose
fields.summary: Feature to schedule a report for all admins that has list of all the users

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Recently, a new custom field *Issue Color* was introduced which allows the user to add the custom field to any of the classic screens.  Once added user could opt for a color option for any issue types associated with this screen. The user could not choose color while creating issues however color could be changed from the view/edit screen later.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add *Issue Color* to any classic project _create issue screen_.
 # Go to create issue screen.
 # You will not get the option to choose the color.
 !Issue Color.png|thumbnail! 
# However, in the Edit/View screen you could choose any color.
 !Color coding.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results

# Create a screen that should allow opting for color code.


h3. Actual Results

# Create screen is noneditable for issue color custom field.


h3. Workaround

Use the Edit/View screen to update the color for the issue key in the classic project.
fields.summary: Issue color custom field is non editable in create issue screen

fields.description:
When we associating a screen to the "Create" transition of a workflow, will see the screen associated with a "blank" workflow, which restricts the users from deleting the screen.

It would be user friendly if we the workflow name is represented instead of a single dot.
fields.summary: On associating a screen to the "Create" transition of a workflow, will see the screen associated with a "dot" workflow.

fields.description:
*Summary*
Currently, Jira mail handler process all the image in incoming email as an attachment. Even if in further reply the image is present as inline it is processed as an attachment.

*Proposed Solution*
Jira should identify the image extension and add them as inline in the comment rather than an attachment.
fields.summary: Image should be processed as inline in comment by mail handler

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In the *Filter Results* gadget, the filter search doesn't show all the filters. If the filter the user is searching for is the 100th filter, typing the filter name doesn't return any results

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create multiple filters (more than 100)
# Try to search for a filter and from the browser call (as shown in the attached screenshot1) make a note of the 100th filter
# Now try to search for the 100th filter and the search doesn't return any results

h3. Expected Result
Users should be able to find all the filters in the gadget filter search

h3. Actual Result
Gadget filter search doesn't show all the filters

h3. Workaround
Use the *Advanced search* option in the gadget and choose the appropriate filter
fields.summary: Filter search in gadget doesn't find all filters
Creating link between two Jira projects fail

fields.description: A select list single choice custom field would not work for a user in Basic search while it works in an advanced search.
fields.summary: Advanced search shows options for a select list single choice custom field whereas basic search shows no options

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In the issue layout configuration for the new issue view, custom fields are included if they are associated with the screen which the issue type uses regardless of if the custom field context excludes the current project.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a custom field
# Add the custom field to a screen used by multiple projects
# Create a new context that restricts the field to a single project
# Remove the default field context
# Configure the issue layout in a project that is not in context for the created custom field

h3. Expected Results
The custom field is not displayed in the issue layout configuration because it is not in context for the project.

h3. Actual Results
The custom field is visible in the issue layout configuration as it is present on the screen that the issue type uses.
 
h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Out of Context Fields Available in Issue Layout Configuration

fields.description:
I want to be able to right click on an existing issue and have a clone option on this menu:

!image-2020-09-20-07-28-05-962.png!

I would want the assignee to be the same, reporter to be the current user, epic link to be copied and the current sprint to be assigned.
fields.summary: Allow clone of work items

fields.description:
As per this. - [https://support.atlassian.com/jira-software-cloud/docs/what-are-service-limits/,]

Daily processing time is  60 min per 12 hrs one which tasks to get queued up and resulting in slowness.

Improving this time would allow users to have a better experience while using A4J
fields.summary: Improve efficiency of Automation rules by increasing Daily processing time and Hourly processing time

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Using @mentions is currently not supported for use in triggering automation. This can be useful for:
 * Approvals
 * Triggering Slack Integration

Among many other options.
h3. Suggested Solution

Allow the use of @mentions to trigger automation.
fields.summary: Add @mentions to Event condition for automation.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Blank screen on A4J rule while trying to add an "Issue fields condition" 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new custom field on your system
# Set the name as: *1. Test*
# Access A4J configuration  
# Add an "Issue fields condition"
# Select the field created on step one.

h3. Expected Results
* You should be able to configure your conditions.

h3. Actual Results
The page goes completely blank and the below exception is thrown at the console:
{noformat}
Error: Cannot set a numeric property on an object
{noformat}

*Notes:*
* It does not affect JSD automation rules.
 
h3. Workaround
You can rename the custom field to something like:
{noformat}
1- Test
{noformat}
fields.summary: Blank screen on A4J rule while trying to add an "Issue fields condition"

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In Jira search, the basic search criteria is reset when search results are sorted

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In Jira search, switch to basic search and select a few search criteria. For example, select a project and assignee from the list.
# Search for the results
# Try to sort one of the fields/columns
# The search criteria selected resets

h3. Expected Result
The search criteria selected should be intact after sorting

h3. Actual Result
Search criteria is reset after sorting

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no workaround for this behavior.

Note: Even after the search criteria is reset, the results shown would be still intact and matches the search.
fields.summary: Basic search resets when search results are sorted

fields.description: Currently Jira Cloud on ipad and macOS is crippled by not being able to view more than one issue or filter at a time. It makes it basically unusable, especially on macOS, for anyone that is using Jira for serious work. I like the improved performance of the native app and I can understand not everything being implemented yet. Not being able to open multiple issues, filters, boards and other views in tabs is in my opinion the most important downside.
fields.summary: Tabs and multiple windows support for Jira Cloud Mobile on macOS and iPadOS

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When viewing the issue detail view in the global issue navigator there appears to be an extra scrollbar on the right side that scrolls the whole view. This only occurs on the global issue navigator and doesn't occur on any other issue views in Jira.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open any issue in the global issue navigator in the detail view.

h3. Expected Results

A scrollbar will appear on both the description/content side and the context side of the issue view if there is more content available than can be displayed in the browser window.
h3. Actual Results

An extra scroll bar appears that allows users to scroll the page just about 100px up and down.
h3. Workaround

No workaround available to hide the extra scroll-bar in the global issue navigator.
fields.summary: Extra scrollbar appearing on the global issue navigator

fields.description:
When you disable to send invitations to new users, or you have reached the 10 user free licenses, or you have pre-approved a domain, you got an error when you add an unsubscribed email to a project:

The error says: "Check your network connection, then give it another try"

It should be more descriptive: "Unable to add a user that is not registered to your site"
fields.summary: Improve adding user error message

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Issue history records the text field updates of an issue (Description and custom text fields) with additional characters in the old issue view.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
1) Create a Jira issue
2) Update description or a custom text field in the issue
3) Open the issue in old issue view and check the history tab for the update made in step 2

h3. Expected Results
The old issue view history section should record the changes made to the text field and should not contain additional ari entries.

h3. Actual Results
The old issue view history section records the update made to the text field along with addition ari information

h3. Workaround
Use the Jira new issue view
fields.summary: Issue history records the text field updates of an issue (Description and custom text fields) with additional ari characters in the old issue view.

fields.description:
Currently, the test cases with StepIDs, Steps_to_Execute, Expected_Results can not be imported in bulk in Zephyr for Jira Cloud.

Please provide the solution for Jira cloud which is similar to Jira Server instance.
fields.summary: CSV Import for Test Cases with Test Steps and Expected Result for Zephyr in Jira Cloud

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Assignee was JQL does not work for usernames with capital letters
h3. Steps to Reproduce

1. Import data from server to cloud. Include a user with capital letters in the username (ie. User.Sample)

|select au.user_key, au.lower_user_name, cu.user_name, cu.email_address, cu.external_id
 from app_user au
 join cwd_user cu on au.lower_user_name = cu.lower_user_name
 and cu.email_address = 'user.ramon@atlasbean.com'|

||user_key||lower_user_name||user_name||email_address||external_id||
|user.sample|user.sample|User.Sample|user.sample@atlasbean.com|5f73302458899e00704f4374|

 2. Import a Jira issue via JSON and assign to the accountID of the user with capital letters on the username.

{code}
{"projects": [{
    "name": "SCRUM TESTING",
    "issues": [
        {   
            "summary": "TEST SUMMARY",
            "creator": "5f73302458899e00704f4374",
            "created": "2020-03-12T09:23:36.897+0000",
            "reporter": "5f73302458899e00704f4374",
            "assignee": "5f73302458899e00704f4374",
            "issueType": "Story",
            "key": "ST-114",
            "externalId": "Ext-ST-114",
            "status": "To Do"
        }
    ],
    "key": "ST"
}]}
{code}

 3. Do a JQL Search:

{{assignee was <ACCOUNTID>}}

h3. Expected Results

The Jira issue where the imported user is assigned should be returned. 

h3. Actual Results

The Jira issue where the imported user is assigned is not returned. 
- {{assignee was <ACCOUNTID>}} does not work
- {{assignee = <ACCOUNTID>}} works. 


h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Assignee was JQL does not work for usernames with capital letters

fields.description:
Currently gadget deletion/addition, aren't logged in the Jira cloud application audit log. 

Adding the audit log feature for dashboard gadgets would be helpful to track them and re-create them if accidentally deleted.
fields.summary: Audit logging for dashboard gadgets

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The user won't be able to choose a specific field from the column configuration in the issue navigator page. Although the custom filed is available for selection, it does not add in the column once opted. 
 !JQL 1.png|thumbnail! 

The problem is observed if the field name and field type is similar in the global custom field and any of the Nextgen project.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
The issue pattern is not consistent. 
# Create a custom field as a global customer
# Create a similar custom field and type in any Nextgen project. 

h3. Expected Results
The field should add up in the column list in the issue navigator page.

h3. Actual Results

Not able to choose the field.

h3. Workaround

* Renaming either of the customer fields should resolve the problem.
* Create a new field and delete the existing one.
fields.summary: Field selection not working in the Column configuration of issue navigation

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
'Add People' button is not working as expected from the People screen
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to the *People* screen
 # Select top-right option *Add People*
 # Add an email address and hit *Send*
h3. Expected Results
Should get a message that the invite was sent 
h3. Actual Results
You will get an error message:
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Workaround

Send invites from the User Management screen or even the Drop Down option of the People screen
fields.summary: 'Add People' button is not working as expected from the People screen

fields.description: Add a *Validation* process in the *External System Import* due to, there is no way to determine the Import will be successful and all data is correct before the import begins.
fields.summary: Add a Validation process in the External System Import

fields.description: Availability to do undo/rollback an External System Import due to an error that could be performed by an Admin.
fields.summary: Availability to do a undo/rollback an External System Import

fields.description:
When a user lacks the browse users and groups global permission and attempts to create a user-based search they get the following error:

"The JIRA server was contacted but has returned an error response. We are unsure of the result of this operation."

Users should either get an error that they lack permission or better, should not have the basic search options for searching on a user at all.

Either way, THIS looks like a system failure.  This error gets people calling the admin team, asking why Jira is failing.
fields.summary: When a user does not have the global permission to browse users they get an error that appears to be a system failure

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary:

Broken links to Confluence pages are not visible in the new issue view. In the old issue view the error "*wiki page failed to load*" is displayed instead of the link.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

1. Open an issue
 2. Link a confluence page in old or new issue view
h3. Expected Results:

Ideally, the confluence links should have been visible as expected in the old issue view and new issue view
!screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!


h3. Actual Results

In the new issue view, sometimes the confluence links are not visible at all, some other times they show an error message like the one in below screenshot:

!Screenshot 2020-11-16 at 19.54.16.png|thumbnail!

In the old issue view, a "*wiki page failed to load*" ** error is displayed.
 !screenshot-6.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

Sometimes this issue is caused by some leftover Application Links pointing to an old Confluence site and it is enough to remove those application links by following the steps in: [How to Remove Application Links via REST API|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-remove-application-link-applinks-via-rest-api-646447740.html]

However, in case this won't work, you may want to [Contact Support|https://support.atlassian.com/contact] in order to have this issue addressed.
fields.summary: Links to Confluence pages broken or not appearing on new and old issue view

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Users unable to see all transitions and status for an issue until scrolling on the transitions window on the new issue view. The scrolling bar is displayed only when the user starts scrolling. Users might be unaware there are more options available.

Example: https://share.getcloudapp.com/p9uwpNAw
h3. Suggested Solution

Option of expand window as in the old issue view.
h3. Workaround

None.
fields.summary: Expand transitions window instead of scrolling

fields.description:
Hi,

I need to have automation working before an issue is created.

Scenario:

User press "create" to to launch the new issue form in Jira

User fills in Summary, then automatically Description field gets info from Summary field

and some extra default text.

Then user fills in the rest of the Description field.

I have looked for triggers before issue is created, but none exist and communication on your forum confirms that triggers before issue is created doesn't exist.
issue must first be created.
fields.summary: Jira Cloud: allow automation before issue is created

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Custom fields created by admins have an optional description. In the old issue view edit modal these descriptions are shown so that end users know what to enter in a particular field. The new issue view does not display these descriptions.
h3. Current behaviour

The new issue view does not display custom field descriptions.
h3. Expected behaviour

The new issue view displays custom field descriptions.
fields.summary: Display custom field "description" text in the new issue view
Sending an empty bulletList on an issue update causes 400 response and non-descriptive error message

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using the Rest API endpoint [_*https://YOUR_INSTANCE.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/issuetype_*|https://your_instance.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/issuetype_], all issue types with the scope information are used on Next-Gen projects, for example:

{code:json}

self: "https://YOUR_INSTANCE.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/issuetype/10156",
id: "10156",
description: "",
iconUrl: "https://YOUR_INSTANCE.atlassian.net/secure/viewavatar?size=medium&avatarId=10321&avatarType=issuetype",
name: "IssueTypeTest",
untranslatedName: "IssueTypeTest",
subtask: false,
avatarId: 10321,
scope: {
  type: "PROJECT",
  project: {
    id: "10144"
  }
}
{code}

Once you move that Next-gen project to the trash, all issue types from that project are shown without the scope under them. This creates bias information, where the customer could get duplicated issue type names without knowing which one is from Classic projects.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Classic Issue type (example: IssueTypeTest)
# Create an Issue type with the same name on a Next-gen project
# Run the Rest API call to see the difference between them (the scope value): [_*https://YOUR_INSTANCE.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/issuetype_*|https://your_instance.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/issuetype_]
# Move this Next-gen project to the trash
# Run the endpoint for step 3 again. 

(i) There is no direct way of knowing what is the Classic field

h3. Expected Results
You can't fetch Issue types from Next-gen project that are on the trash.

h3. Actual Results

You fetch Issue types that seem to be from Classic, but they aren't foundable on the UI.

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Rest API shows Issue Types without scope for Next-gen projects moved to trash

fields.description: In order to track changes to versions, it would be great if the Version Updated trigger in Automation could have Smart Values other than version.name – having version.Start date and Version.End date would allow the ability to notify stakeholders that versions have changed and more importantly, what changed (start or end date). Right now, Jira Admins have to go into the Audit Log to gather up changes like this as they're not stored in Jira.  Yes, they're available thru REST but it would be great to leverage this functionality for Advanced Roadmaps.
fields.summary: Add smart values for version.Start date and version.End Date

fields.description:
In Jira Android app, the *Version picker* is not supported and any custom field created with the version picker field type is not visible in the issue view.

The field is visible in the Web and iOS Jira app.
fields.summary: Provide support for Version picker custom field in Jira Android app

fields.description: It will be good if there was an ability to build different request types using the dynamic forms, including the dependency on the key fields to build the form. For e.g, If a user selects 'IT Service Desk' from Portal and then selects a form to 'Report an Incident' a form with key fields is presented, and then depending on the System selection remainder of the form is built.
fields.summary: Dynamic form for Request Type

fields.description:
Users should be able to configure their projects to display the previous key of moved issues. This information is important to report generation.

Therefore, this feature request is to display the old issue key, and the new issue key after the ticket has been moved.
fields.summary: Display the previous key of moved issues

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Error Message when using URL of an issue from Classic Business Project
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open a Classic Business Project board and select an issue
 # Select the URL from the browser and hit *Enter* in your keyboard

h3. Expected Results

Should reopen the issue again
h3. Actual Results

You will get an error message and a blank page landing in the Board from the Project

!screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!

[^JRACLOUD-75171.webm]

From the console logs somehow it looks like it is not finding the JSON file from the path:
{code:java}
react-dom.production.min.js:209 TypeError: Cannot read property 'baseUrl' of null
    at cb (utils.js:55)
    at lb (utils.js:206)
    at main.js:137
    at Object.useMemo (react-dom.production.min.js:165)
    at t.useMemo (react.production.min.js:25)
    at AppProvider (main.js:136)
    at Ga (react-dom.production.min.js:153)
    at hc (react-dom.production.min.js:261)
    at ls (react-dom.production.min.js:246)
    at cs (react-dom.production.min.js:246){code}
h3. Workaround

Currently, the only workaround for this is loading the full issue view and copying the link from there to share it
fields.summary: Error Message when using URL of an issue from Classic Business Project

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
 * In the 'Switch To' menu in Jira, we have Jira Software, Jira Service Desk, Confluence, Bitbucket, etc. However, the Jira Business option is missing on this menu. This is causing inconvenience to users who are having only the 'Jira Business project'. They need to use the various other links to navigate to their projects which is resulting in additional clicks.

h3. Suggested Solution

Provide the Jira Business project option in addition to the existing options in the 'Switch To' menu for easier navigation.
h3. Workaround
 # Use the 'manage list' option in the menu to put a custom filter like below. Please check the attached screenshot also once.

 https://xxxx.atlassian.net/secure/BrowseProjects.jspa?page=1&selectedCategory=all&selectedProjectType=business&sortKey=name&sortOrder=ASC
fields.summary: Jira Business project users need Business project option in the 'Switch To' menu for easier navigation.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If there is a custom field with Text field ( single line) we cannot seem to edit the value if the field name is "Parent".
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a custom field of type Text field ( single line ) called "Parent-new"
 #  Add this to relevant screens in your project.
# Set some value to it in a Jira issue.
# Now change the custom field name to "Parent".
# Go back to the issue and try to edit this field.

h3. Expected Results
We should be able to edit this field.

h3. Actual Results
We get an error "We couldnt save your changes , copy the content and then try again" 



h3. Workaround
Rename the custom field "Parent" to something else.
fields.summary: Changing field value  on a Text field ( Single line ) custom field with "Parent" name does not work

fields.description:
* Connect a channel to a project
 * Create an issue in the connected channel via /jira create. It should work at that point
 * Move connected project to trash or delete it 
 * Click on the Manage button against the project name in the channel settings

You will be redirected to a dead link and will not be able to remove it
fields.summary: Project deletion web-hook is missed in Jira slack integration

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The keys to navigate (Up/Down/Home/PgUp/End/etc/) don't work in the issue view.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Search for some issues in the Search Issue view. 
 # Select one of the results to view the issue
 # Press the Down/Up or Pg Down/Up keys.
 [^bug_navigation.mp4]

h3. Expected Results

Pressing the down/up or Pg Down/Up keys scrolls through the issue.

h3. Actual Results

The Scroll container doesn't gain the focus when you click on it, unable to use the Keys to navigate.

h3. Notes;

This also happens by simple opening an issue in the new issue view from other functions.

h3. Workaround
 * Reload the page.
 * Use the tab key to select the area of the screen that you'd like to scroll at which point page up/page down will work.
fields.summary: Up/down and Pg Down/Up keys in the issue view don't work
JQL to find issues that have exactly only one Sprint

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In the Jira and Slack integration, when users try to create an issue from a message, the options to select the site and project are available, but the issue type isn't.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a channel
# Integrate Jira and Slack using the created channel
# Add a message to the channel
# Next to the message, click on *More actions > Create issue from Jira Cloud*
# Select the site and project
# Click on *Choose issue type*

h3. Expected Results

The list of issue types of the project is displayed and users and pick-up one option

h3. Actual Results

Only the option *Select project* is visible and later the message *Nothing could be found* is displayed

 !Screen Shot 2020-09-23 at 5.14.30 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

In the *Issue type* field in Slack, type any value in the field and then delete it. This will make the issue type names visible and selectable.
fields.summary: The Slack integration isn't allowing users to select the issue type when creating an issue from a message

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When accessing either a Kanban bard view, or a Scrum board view, Chrome shows a security warning:
 !Screen Shot 2020-05-20 at 09.42.38.png|thumbnail! 

That's not being caused by an actual effective security breach, but because that page is loading an image from a non HTTPS domain:
 !Screen Shot 2020-05-20 at 09.45.12.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce

Access a kanban or scrum board of a JSW project.

h3. Expected Results

No security warning messages should be displayed, the site should still be marked as secure.

h3. Actual Results

A security warning is displayed.

h3. Workaround

We can't avoid that until that resource is removed/modified. So there is no workaround at the moment.
fields.summary: Chrome shows security warning when in an Agile board view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

After the implementation of https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-75103, one scenario was not considered. When you have multiple field configurations, the Basic Search Mode only returns the first pair of Ids of the custom field value.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a cascade custom field and create field context.
 # insert a new value to the field in each context, resulting in the same "PARENT VALUE=>CASCADE VALUE1" value has different entries in the fieldconfigscheme database table. 
 # In the basic mode, select the Cascade Value "PARENT VALUE=>CASCADE VALUE1" and only the first pair of Ids is retrieved.

h3. Expected Results

It should retrieve all the Pairs of Ids to retrieve full results
h3. Actual Results

Since Basic Mode retrieves only the first Pair of Ids it returns partial results.
h3. Workaround

Use the JQL mode and enter the string values: "Cascade Field[Select List (cascading)]" = "CASCADE VALUE1"
fields.summary: Cascade Fields in Basic Search Mode is truncated.

fields.description: Currently while creating Created vs Resolved gadget. we have to choose the exact number of previous days in  *Days Previously* section however this should be enhanced in a way that it allows users to select options like the previous month, quarter, year,custom date range etc, and not just the exact number of days.
fields.summary: Created vs Resolved gadget - Days Previously field should be enhanced in a way to select past 1 month, quarter, annual etc

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Uploading a file via the JSON/CSV importer fails when the upload duration reaches 60s. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Use the External System Importer
 # Choose CSV or JSON
 # Upload a large file. 
 
h3. Expected Results

The large file should be uploaded.

h3. Actual Results

When the upload duration exceeds 60 seconds, the upload will fail with a permission error. 

{code}
Cannot attach file FILENAME: You do not have permission to attach a file to the issue.
{code}

 !bug.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Uploading a file via the JSON/CSV importer fails when the duration reaches 60s.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When you try to add a custom field with special characters or accents in its name to show in the "Filter Results" gadget on a dashboard, it doesn't consider the added custom field.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add a "Filter Results" gadget to a dashboard;
# Select to show a custom field with special characters:
 !Screen Shot 2020-09-23 at 10.37.11.png|thumbnail! 
# Save it;
# The custom field doesn't show in the gadget:
!image-2020-09-23-10-38-50-253.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
The gadget should show the custom field selected.


h3. Actual Results
There is no error showing in the requests that the browser is doing and the custom field is not showing in the gadget results.

h3. Workaround

For now, it would be necessary to remove the special character or accents from the custom field.
fields.summary: Filter Results gadget doesn't show custom field with special characters/accent

fields.description:
h3. Problem
Eventually, automation for Jira rules might create a "race condition" with other features, such as connect plugins.

h3. Suggested resolution
Having the ability to delay automation for Jira rules would be useful for preventing such scenarios.
fields.summary: Ability to delay Automation for Jira rule executions
